result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Plea/sentencing hearing on January 4, 2023 at 11:00 am.

01:56 PM Defendant Triston Todd Lafferty in court with attorney Christin Marie Saint Pierre, via zoom.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State ask that this bail/bond forfeiture just track. Atty Saint Pierre doesn't object. Court grants request. Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Court calls 21CT19 & 22CM6 @ 01:31 PM Defendant Triston Todd Lafferty in court with attorney Catherine Tang & Christin Marie Saint Pierre.   Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 22CM6 Atty Saint Pierre has copy of complaint, special appearance, reserve rights, waives reading and enters Not Guilty plea.  Court receives Not Guilty plea.  Both attorney would like Status Cnf.  Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Acknowledgement by Bail Depositor
Canceled warrant with L.S. @ 1:34 pm
Maintain Absolute Sobriety.  No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.  No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

01:28 PM/Rm. 301/Defendant Triston Todd Lafferty in court.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA and Reporter by Zoom.  Court calls 22-CM-6 and 21-CT-19.  Warrant vacated.  Def. is still asking for a public defender.  AIA set on 22-CM-6 and St. Conf. on 21-CT-19.  State asks previous bond posted remain in forfeiture status.  Bond recommendation by State.  Response by Def.  Court orders previous bond to remain in forfeiture status.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

04:13 PM Defendant Triston Todd Lafferty not in court.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom.  State request warrant, $1,000 cash or body.  Court authorize warant 1,000 cash or body, and moves to forfeit bond pending hearing.

02:12 PM Defendant Triston Todd Lafferty in court.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews history of case.  Def. is still waiting for a P.D.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

02:50 PM Defendant Triston Todd Lafferty in court.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom.  Court reviews history of case.  Def. will continue to wait for P.D. Bond continues.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

03:26 PM Defendant Triston Todd Lafferty in court.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews history of case.  Def. explains why missed court. Court vacates warrant and reinstates bond.   Def. would like to represent himself.  Court goes over waiver of atty rights with def.  Def. now would like counsel. Def. needs to contact P.D. State heard on atty status.  State ask the forfeit remain and get signature bond.  Court denies and will reinstate bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

02:21 PM Defendant Triston Todd Lafferty not in court.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom. State request warrant, $1,000 or body, Langlade/adj and moves to forfeit bond. Court authorize warrant $1,000 cash or body, Langlade/Adj and bond forfeiture pending hearing.

Bail/Bond
No use of alcohol.  No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.   No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

01:10 PM Defendant Triston Todd Lafferty in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Triston Todd Lafferty appeared by video means.  All parties via zoom.    Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. is going to contact P.D.  State gives bail/bond recommendation, No use of alcohol, No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license & No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Def. makes statement on bond. Court orders $300 cash bond with conditions.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
